intro: Payena longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled payena, is a tropical shrub native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated petioles, which are the stalks connecting the leaves to the stem. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Payena longipetiolata is often found in humid forest understories and is adapted to low-light conditions.
